items.title: Live: Properties feared lost in Victorian fire as extreme heat strikes
items.description: A heatwave stretching across southern Australia is in its second day, with properties feared lost in an out-of-control bushfire in central Victoria.

items.title: 'Get out of Minneapolis': Mayor's fury after ICE agent shoots and kills woman
items.description: The mayor of Minneapolis says the Trump administration's claim that the incident was self-defence is not true and told Immigration and Customs Enforcement to get out of the city.

items.title: Why Trump's threat to Greenland hinges on NATO's Article 5
items.description: Donald Trump has made it clear he's departing from decades of US foreign policy norms and once-close allies are now questioning what it could mean for them.

items.title: US seizes more tankers as it lays out three-phase plan for Venezuela
items.description: Russia says one of the Venezuela-linked tankers is "our vessel" and demands the quick release of its citizens, as the US pledges to continue seizing ships and keep the pressure on Venezuela's interim leaders.

items.title: A derailed freight train has shut a key railway line. Here's what we know
items.description: The derailment of a freight train on a key section of railway in South Australia is affecting all transcontinental train services as heatwave conditions in the area impact the pace of recovery works.

items.title: 'Bunch of cash': The big little fundraiser causing problems for the NSW premier
items.description: A decade-old Labor fundraiser at the centre of allegations that NSW Premier Chris Minns conspired to evade a state donations law was reported at the time as a much bigger event than official records suggest, the ABC can reveal.

items.title: Live: England fumes as more snicko drama costs tourists in Aussie run chase
items.description: Brydon Carse is left fuming after Jake Weatherald is given a life despite appearing to edge the ball behind as Australia chases 160 runs to win on day five at the SCG. Follow live.

items.title: Peake's last-ball six hands Renegades controversial win over Scorchers
items.description: Ollie Peake survives a contentious overturned catch to smash a six on the final delivery to seal a four-wicket win for the Melbourne Renegades in Perth.

items.title: Far North Queensland braces for a deluge of rain and possible cyclone
items.description: A tropical low has been declared over the Coral Sea and it is expected to move towards the Far North Queensland coast over the next few days. The bureau said there is a moderate chance it could develop into a tropical cyclone.

items.title: Police issue alert over man, white ute after shooting in WA's Midwest
items.description: A manhunt is underway for 58-year-old Kenneth John Giles who allegedly fled with a firearm after a shooting on a rural property near Mullewa, about 450 kilometres north of Perth, with a woman suffering non-life-threatening injuries.

items.title: NSW police storm house, fatally shoot man after six-hour siege
items.description: Tactical Operations police burst into the Central Coast house and opened fire on a 49-year-old armed with a sharp object who tried to set fire to an officer using an aerosol can, police say.

items.title: How the 'American in Australia' trend reveals something about us and them
items.description: Americans are posting sunny social media dispatches about their new lives in Australia, but there is something more revealing underneath.

items.title: Live: ASX opens up, gold and oil prices remain 'choppy'
items.description: The Aussie market has opened higher as the price of gold and oil remain "choppy". Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: 13yo boys survive crash when car splits during police chase
items.description: The teenagers have been taken from Lithgow to a Sydney hospital after a pursuit began on the Great Western Highway.

items.title: NDIS worker allegedly left home before client sparked fatal fire
items.description: Mohammed Khryzat, 38, died after a blaze ripped through a home on River Avenue Carramar in April 2021, having allegedly been left unsupervised by a care worker the night before.

items.title: Huge 4.9m-long crocodile pulled from NT creek that feeds popular waterfall
items.description: Rangers in the Northern Territory have caught an average of a crocodile per day in the first week of 2026, including one measuring 4.9 metres pulled from waters near a popular swimming spot.

items.title: Australian stars receive nods in 2026 SAG Actor Award nominations
items.description: Australian names are among the mix of nominees unveiled for Hollywood's Actor Awards, formerly known as the Screen Actors Guild Awards.

items.title: Israel cleared to start West Bank settlement construction
items.description: Critics say the E1 project would prevent the establishment of a contiguous Palestinian state.

items.title: Ex-CIA agent convicted of spying for Soviets dies in prison
items.description: Aldrich Ames, who was 84, betrayed Western intelligence assets to the Soviet Union and Russia in one of the most damaging intelligence breaches in US history.

items.title: First Nations rally organiser vows to defy 'inhumane' NSW protest laws
items.description: Paul Silva says he plans to defy NSW's new protest restrictions to rally against Indigenous deaths in custody.

items.title: Peel boosts Aussie Winter Olympics hopes with World Cup victory
items.description: After recently struggling for form, Australian star Laura Peel strikes gold at the aerials World Cup event in Canada in her best showing of the season.

items.title: The Brisbane team pulling together to keep an ancient sport alive
items.description: The ancient sport of tug of war is being kept alive in Brisbane by an enthusiastic team, and some are calling for it to return to the Olympics.

items.title: Tiebreak defeat spells end for Special Ks at Brisbane International
items.description: Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis's doubles campaign at the Brisbane International has come to an end after an entertaining tiebreak decider against France.

items.title: Two-time major winner Gauff heaps praise on rising Aussie star Joint
items.description: World number four Coco Gauff describes Maya Joint as a "great talent" ahead of a potential match-up against the 19-year-old Australian at the United Cup.

items.title: Australian teenager Jones targeting massive rankings jump in 2026
items.description: Emerson Jones gave a glimpse of her potential at the Brisbane International, with her 2026 season getting underway in promising fashion.
